reviews.review_msg: She is super unclear. Does not give you instructions as to what she wants, but expects certain results. Trying to clarify with her via email was difficult. She does not respond sometimes.

she is the worst, I have never had a class where EVERYONE (i mean everyone) is lost. You kinda just get thrown into the material and project, with little to no guidance. Instructions are always super unclear. I love french, but this class is making me rethink my minor.

This is my second time taking Gaelle's class and the instructions, lectures and everything were still just as confusing. I have taken a class with her before so I was prepared for it, but it was clear that those taking her for the first time struggled. She started becoming passive-aggressive in-person and in her emails this term which is new.
She's a really kind prof and a good listener.

Gaelle is a kind person, but lacks as a professor. Her instructions and expectations were not clear. Her lectures were okay, but sort of hard to follow at times. She comes of, in my opinion, as a lazy person. She doesn't check emails, doesn't respond to people, and is hard to find outside of class. I didn't feel comfortable asking her questions.
Criteria is always very vague and seems to grade very subjectively. Would not recommend

Gaelle is clearly a kind woman. However, I did find this class to be disorganized and a bit hard to follow. Also, there is a group project that runs for the whole semester so if you get stuck in a bad group, prepare to hate this class. More clarity on what was expected & organization on Canvas would have helped this class.

She can be a hard marker (always check your grammar). She's a little disorganized; she didn't give us the dates for the assignments and exams or their percentage worth. Definitely attend the lectures and participate, she'll appreciate the effort and you'll get a better grade. Not a lot of time provided for the exams so prepare in advance.

Definitely not a favourite of mine. She's really vague with her instructions. She gets due dates mixed up and then gets annoyed when people don't hand in the work on time. I honestly didn't learn very much. You can get away with skipping as long as you do the work. She gives good feedback; that's the only good thing about her.

My absolute favourite French prof at SFU! She's very understanding and available for meetings even outside her office hours, responds to emails quickly. Her classes are mainly lecture style, but she keeps it interesting. She can be a bit vague with her assignment outlines, so if you're confused make sure to ask for help.

Gaelle is a nice person, but does not have great teaching skills. She is often unclear regarding assignment criteria and is not very helpful if you see her outside of class. Her marking is inconsistent and we didn't cover much material over the course of 3 months.

GaÃ«lle is the prof I will only take a class with if I absolutely have to. She has good intentions, however, they come off the wrong way. I took a linguistics class before this one in English and I'm thankful I did as it made this class easier. I found her very unclear about her expectations and she wasn't consistent with what she wanted from us.

Absolutely loved her class! Her lectures were really clear, and her power points are also clear. Her marking is fair. Don't expect to get a lot of help from her through e-mail, it's better to go see her during her office hours.

Found that for more than one assignment or test, you went in having an idea of what she wanted, and then came out with feedback from her that made you think, well you didn't say that's what you wanted..

I'm surprised to see so many critical reviews of Gaelle, I personally found her to be one of the best instructors in SFU's French department. She is very open to feedback, cares about and respects her students, and genuinely seems to enjoy her job. Her expectations were clear and she was readily available for extra help. I'd take her classes again.

Gaelle is super friendly and approachable, passionate about course material. Her criteria might be confusing at first but if you go talk to herask her for clarification, she is more than willing to explain. You get the effort you put out.  Thanks to her, I learned a new way of looking at cinema. Highly recommended, definitely not a 25 prof!
Confusing, disorganised, subjective in marking, follow rigid France education system, not open for discussion, only what she says that matters
Third course with her.  My favourite prof at SFU.
Really nice.  Class was fun and interesting.  Would take her clases again.

She was so disorganized that it was painful. During drop- in office hours, she makes several appointments with other students, therefore, not having any time for anyone else. What is the point of drop-in hours if you are all booked up?! I will never take another course with her.

Students (like me) who were in french immersion won't find the class too challenging; not so much if you know minimal french. She's really nice and sweet, but she can be really confusing at times. Also the material she chooses to discuss are really pointless and boring.

Gaelle is an extremely empathetic and approachable professor. She certainly does have expectations regarding the quality of work that students hand in, but is more than willing to provide assistance and facilitates and environment in which non-Francophones can contribute to the class.

This professor may sometimes give more information than required and this could confuse students a little... However, her passion for the subject is way up high!  She is ever so willing to go out of her way to help those that wish to succeed and she is just too adorable!  One of my best profs ever!!!

Although she can be somewhat disorganized and provide more information than necessary, she is extremely knowledgeable.  I have found that only students who do poorly in her class don't like her so I don't know how valid that opinion is. She is super helpful.  She even helps students after they've graduated!  Welcomes criticism about class.
Very ambiguous and unclear.  She didn't even give us criteria for the project that is worth 50% of our grade... =(

She is confusing as heck. The articles that she chooses to bring to class are equally as confusing.  I would avoid having this woman if at all possible. In terms of giving help, she is useless, she doesn't really do much in terms of providing guidance.  She just expects you to figure everything out.
Why is she a prof? Disorganized, confusing lectures, unfair marking, prententious attitude, she must be the worse lecturer I have ever had.
She assigns way too much work and has very high expectations from the undergrad student.
100% agree with the comment posted on oct 5, 2007
DO NOT LIKE HER! CONFUSING CLASSES!
She Sucks! Frustrated, arrogant, impolite, confused, hard marker. Never available for help.Avoid her!

She constantly has to maintain an air of superiority over her students. Her instructions are confusing and her helpfulness clarifying is weak(her way or the highway). She is nice enough, but you may not get anything out of her classes. I strongly discourage taking her any of her classes.

gaelle is passionate about linguistics. although her she talks very fast, i adjusted to her speed as time went on. she is a harder prof but i recommend her b/c she prepares you better for 370. she can be a bit confusing at times but i think it's becuase some of the material is very confusing. be prepared to learn the linguistics alphabet onyour own
I think I took the same class with he person below me, yes I 100% agree with the person below me.... I never got an F ever in my life and she gave me an F.....

It was a very difficult class for me. You can't study for her class. If you are from immersion that spell and know grammar well, you'll do well in her class. Not for people with "minimum" experience with French as a language.
